description.narrative: The Project's development objective is to increase access to urban services and improve urban management in selected cities of Benin.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Project Cities’ Capacity Assessment | Description :Recipient shall carry out jointly with the Association, acapacity assessment of the Project Cities regarding Project implementation in the technical, engineering, management, social andenvironment areas to determine whether the responsibility for Project implementation can, in agreement with the Association, betransferred from delegated management agency to qualified Project Cities. | Due Date :31-May-2017

Finance Agreement :Recruitment of Internal Auditor | Description :MEHU shall (a) not later than 6 months after the Effective Date:(a) select and appoint in accordance with the provisions of Section III of this Schedule an independent auditor to carry out theabove referenced audit; and (b) within thirty (30) days after the completion of each such audit, furnish the report thereof to theAssociation for its review and comments. | Due Date :02-Apr-2014

Finance Agreement :Submission of Annual Work Plans and budget to ISC and IDA | Description :MEHU shall (b) ensure that theTechnical Secretariat submits annual Project work plans and budget to Interministerial Steering Committee (ISC) and theAssociation for their respective prior review and approval. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Training and installation of project and accounting software | Description :Recipient shall carry out actionsagreed with the Association for the strengthening of the financial management and procurement capacity for the Project, including:(a) pertinent training in Project procurement rules for TS and Project City local government staff; (b) the acquisition andinstallation, satisfactory to the Association, of appropriate computer hardware and accounting software. | Due Date :02-Apr-2014

title.narrative: Number of cities completing and updating asset inventory yearly.
Number of cities generating, disclosing, and discussing quarterly progress reports on their annual budget
Number of cities dedicating at least 15 percent of municipal revenue to infrastructure maintenance
Number of additional population provided with access to other basic services
Number of municipality officials trained in fiduciary, safeguards, project management and engineering services
Number of additional people in participating cities' urban areas protected from seasonal flooding
Number of additional people with improved access to all-season roads within 500 meter range under project
Number of central government officials trained in IFTS management and financial auditing of municipalities.
Percentage of resources from the optional tranche of PAURAD transferred to beneficiary communes through FADEC
Length of drainage and anti-erosion flood reduction works rehabilitated or constructed.
Number of cities with a manual of administrative and financial management procedures in use
IFTS formula agreed between Central Government and Municipalities and put to use.
